comments: ENG101 an mandatory course that should be interesting and compelling and turns it into painful curriculum. Sandy is very strict and picky. He talks to his students like they are small children. The con is, this is not an easy class - reading assignment EVERY night. Taking up all of times that should distribute to your other courses, and F.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (7)  Gives good feedback (6)  Participation matters (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Hilarious (2)  Caring (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: I loved this semester with Professor Singer. He is very understanding and he cares about your attendance. He moves quickly and precisely with assignments. His due dates are vital, so hand in all work ON TIME. He will call you out if you show up late, and of course, nobody likes that. Overall, I highly recommend students chose Professor Singer.

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (7)  Gives good feedback (6)  Participation matters (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Hilarious (2)  Caring (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
stu_tags: CARING  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: Prof. Singer is an amazing English teacher! Very friendly and cares about students. His curriculum contains 3-4 short papers, quizzes and a term paper. Hardly any homework. No Midterm! Most work consists of light reading. The few papers we had were spaced out by weeks. DO NOT USE YOUR PHONE OR TALK! Just do the light work he gives and you\'ll pass.

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (7)  Gives good feedback (6)  Participation matters (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Hilarious (2)  Caring (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  SO MANY PAPERS  LOTS OF HOMEWORK
comments: You\'ll learn A LOT from his class. He gives a lot of worksheets and papers about the lesson, so have a separate folder. He tells you a head of time when there will be a quiz or an exam (midterm and final). He gives a fair amount of homework and accepts them through email. His text book is mandatory but you can get it for cheap, around $5.

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice

comments: DO NOT TAKE HIM! He is a horrible professor, strict grader, for attendance you must be there everyday (rain, hail, and snow*) doesn\'t care about your other classes. Gives you four to five homework every lecture class. If you miss a class he embarrasses you in front of the whole class stating he needs to talk to you after class. No extra credit.

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (7)  Gives good feedback (6)  Participation matters (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Hilarious (2)  Caring (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Prof. Singer is very organized and clear on what he expects. He gives assignments and readings on daily basis that are short, sweet and easy. His exams and quizzes reflect only the material he covered, no surprises! I loved every class and learned so much, and only studied 10-15 min for each class, of course you have to pay attention, too. Enjoy.

comments: Great professor!! Very friendly person and he explains everything in detail! He gives a good amount of homework, but if you want to pass the CATW you need to practice anyway! I would take another English class with him in a heart beat! If you have the chance to have him as your professor go for it!

comments: Amazing professor, you will learn a lot after taking his course. He assigns homework at the end of each class. You wont have to worry about participation, because he calls on everyone in the class to answer a question. He is a tough grader , but its only to help you. You will need the textbook for the assignments. He gives a few test and quizzes

comments: Prof. Singer is a good teacher, I have learned a lot from him. He gives a lot of hand outs so be prepared to do a lot of work. If you keep up and read handouts and do the work you will pass. He is also very understandable and will always try to work with you as much as he can. I would definitely take him again.

comments: This guy, honestly, is not a bad teacher. I do find the way he grades things a little fishy, but I also learned a couple of things from him teaching. He is a great person, very understanding, and flexible at times with certain assignments. Overall he is FAIR.
